intro: Melicope sessiliflora, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally by Native Hawaiians for medicinal purposes. Melicope sessiliflora plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
